newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to allow zero-tariff on electronic import.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to allow zero-tariff on electronic import.

text.p: Taiwan will allow a zero-tariff on 289 imported electronic and communication products after it gains access to the World Trade Organisation, finance ministry officials said on Friday.

"The ministry has completed a draft revision to the tariff law in a bid to reduce the import duties on 289 such items in four stages, with tariffs being removed entirely as soon as Taiwan joins the WTO," a ministry spokeswoman said.
Under the plan, the rates would be reduced to 3.52, 2.34, 1.17 and zero percent in four stages, she said, but did not give the time frame for implementation.
Currently, averaged nominal tariff for these products, including electronic components, telephones and data processors, is 4.69 percent, she said.
Ministry officials said the revised bill would be sent to cabinet for approval before sending to parliament for review. They hoped the revised bill could become effective in July.
Taiwan, seeking to enter the World Trade Organisation, has stepped up efforts to liberalise its markets and comply with international practices.
